body.name: Fotopro Lightweight Phone Tripod with Remote,40 inches Camera Tripod Stand FY 583 with Bag Phone Mount for iPhone Camera
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 12 hrs 8 mins
features: 【Lightweight Phone Tripod Indeed】With weight of 0.39 kg (0.85 lb) and only 11 inches when packed up, the travel tripod is the perfect size to accompany you while traveling, climbing, and camping, etc. It is easy to get the height you need (11 to 40 inches) Max Load capacity: 2.2 pounds.

【Compact & Easily Operate】 This compact tripod for camera is designed with a quick open system that assists you to set up it quickly. Timing is the key when you are shooting for some beautiful moments. You only get one shot, so don't miss it.

【360° Panorama】This cell phone tripod features a 3-way pan head with a handle, which allows both 90-degree vertical and 360 degrees panoramic shooting according to your preferences. At the same time, the spirit level contributes to exact horizontal alignment.
【Long-distance shooting】The tripod for iPhone allow you to shoot from max 33 feet away. Perfect for taking group photos, like family gather, leaving precious pictures.

【Tripod for Phone and Camera】Phone clamp works with most smartphones within 3.3 Inches width, such as iPhone with case. The camera stand has a 1/4 screw quick release plate that helps to quickly connect most digital devices to the stand.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Fotopro is an award-winning global brand that designs, manufactures, and markets a wide range of photographic equipment for professional photographers. Our product line includes an extensive range of camera tripods, monopods, heads, and accessories. We maintain the highest standard of quality in our products while still offering an affordable solution to our customers. Our mission is to provide photographers with the right tools to unleash their creative potential.

3 Way Swivel Pan Head with Quick Release Plate You no longer need to hand your camera or mobile to a stranger to capture a beautiful full-sized picture of yours. Simply, get this mind-blowing Fotopro phone tripod stand and snap plenty of your full-sized gorgeous pictures on your own. -By RS Review TIPS: In the 2020 latest edition, the Fotopro phone tripod has enhanced the overall quality of phone tripod including the sturdiness of the legs, mounting flexibility, and even the packaging. We keep working on the improvement very seriously to deliver flawless products.

Portable You Need, Portable Indeed Small Enough to Carry Weight as 0.85 lb(0.39 KG), the folded height is only 11"/28cm, small enough to store in your backpack. In order to maximize the portable feature, the lightweight tripod is not designed extremely stable for the camera. Please confirm the hight and load capacity（1 KG）carefully before purchasing. Along with a durable Tripod Bag, easy for you to carry while you are outside for traveling, climbing, and camping, etc

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really handy tripod
reviews.reviewText: It's really not the most stable tripod in the world when the legs are extended fully, but it's really not bad for what you pay for. The legs extend quite a ways giving you a lot of height range to play with. Plus it has a handy bubble level at the top of the tripod to help you get everything level in your shot. It folds down and fits in a nice (included) bag that won't take up much room in your pack. This is just what I was looking for. It may struggle with a really heavy camera mounted to it, but for holding a phone it's perfect. I was able to pair the remote easily. Push a button on the remote and it will take a picture, or use the button to start/stop video recording. Really not a bad product for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Tri-Pod system for a smart phone . . .
reviews.reviewText: It seems like it's hard to find a good place to prop up a smart phone for a group pic. You simply need a stand/tri-pod to do it right! This is a great Tri-Pod system for a smart phone. Actually the tri-pod will work with any point-shoot camera, or others if the camera is not too large/heavy. Included are tripod, smart phone mount, Bluetooth shutter control button, and carry case. Using the control button with camera set on 3 sec delay it works great for group pics as the 3 secs give you time to hide the button/hand. The shutter button can of course be used without the tripod on any camera with a Bluetooth feature. I like this tri-pod ‘cause it’s small and will easily fit in my Harley saddle bag. very good quality and a very reasonable price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality for the price - great starter tripod!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this tripod as a simple stand for recording videos and taking group photos. Other reviews had positive things to say, but once I actually got my hands on it I was very impressed. It's not the mot sophisticated tripod, but I'm really pleased and surprised with how great the quality is for the price.PROS: Easy to assemble the tripod itself and to get it prepared for photos. I only have a smartphone so I can't weigh in on how it does with digital cameras. As far as smartphones go, it was a breeze to set it up to hold my phone. I have an iPhone 7 Plus and the clamp fit it very well without a case on it. The legs are also easy to extend up and down and they twist into place so you don't have to worry about a leg collapsing and damaging any equipment it's holding. Also, the Bluetooth shutter button that comes with it was one of the easiest Bluetooth syncs I've ever experienced. If you follow the included instructions for syncing, it only takes a moment to get it set up. The shutter button works for not only photos, but also to start and stop video recording.CONS: My only complaint is that I have a protective case on my phone that i had to remove because it was too tight with it on. It makes me a little nervous to set my phone on a tripod without the case, but from what I understand that's pretty common for smartphone tripods. I'll also note that the legs are sturdy when holding a phone and would probably support a simple digital camera, but it's possible they might be a bit unstable for a very heavy camera, though it's hard to say for sure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this tripod for an entirely different purpose. When it was delivered, I found that it was actually too large for that. shame, because it is more sturdy than the ones that actually work. Then I found that I can mount my video projector on it. No more looking for something about the right height. Set it up, turn on the video, and enjoy.At night, I can set it up outside, pointed at the building across the yard, and I have a 20 foot wide television for far less money than a 50 inch screen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
reviews.reviewText: It's cheap, and using it you understand why. It works fine, but I can tell after having it fully extended for a while, the legs want to bow slightly. Nothing terrible, but throwing that out there. The legs lock in place by having those little metal nodes pop out and hold the leg in place, and I can imagine after some use, that may become less dependable. But for now, it's fine. The contraption to hold your phone is handy. It holds on tight, and more so the bigger your phone is since it has a spring to hold it together. I have it hold the lower part of my Pixel 2. I know it has a squeeze function to it, but it doesn't seem to cause it any trouble. (Internally I scream though because I hate it holding on so tight.) I should've measured how it would be. It sits around waist height for me, so to not having it looking up at me at probably the worst angle, I'll need to set it on something. Otherwise, I like it. The bluetooth control is real handy as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good fitness/travel companion
reviews.reviewText: I've had my Fotopro Phone Tripod Stand for over 2 years now. I use it extensively to workout with my trainer (virtually) 2-3 times a week, and record videos outdoor sometimes. It's light, can be extended to provide a great viewing angle, and support large phones.The tripod is light enough that I can carry around in string/gym bag and golf bag. The 3 legs provide great stability indoor and also on the grass outdoor. Soccer fields and golf courses are where I've taken mine to before. On the golf course, it has no issue withstanding low-mid wind.The height can be adjusted so that you could film from the ground level (around a foot from the ground) and all the way to the body level. My personal trainer also mentioned that it got tall enough to provide a full body angle when extended fully, and can see my whole body when placing it 4-5 ft away. It's great when there's little space in your gym.It can also hold large phones. I have an iPhone 11 Max, and have no issue with it. But you might have to take your case out (depending on how thick your case is). The lock that prevents your phone from rotating is probably the only unintuitive feature of this tripod, but it didn't take me long to figure it out. Once in a while it might become loose, and you'll have to tighten it up. Just play with it when you open the box, and you'll be fine.Overall, spending less than $30 for a tripod that I use multiple times a week for over 2 years is definitely money well spent!

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap. Flimsy. Spend a little more $$ to avoid frustration!
reviews.reviewText: Absolute piece of trash. Did the job for the couple months I could use it but this thing could not possibly hold up a camera— it barely held up my phone! Flimsy, cheap, get what you pay for item.As you can see every single leg has snapped off from normal, gentle use (literally will snap if you’re pulling the legs out). I’ve had to glue and tape this dang thing so many times ! Blegh!
Excelente, es muy sencillo, fácil y práctico de usar.Lo recomiendo mucho. Tiene muy buen soporte para el celular. El diseño me encantó.

Me gustó mucho este tripié. La calidad del material es muy buena, a pesar de ser delgado tiene una excelente estabilidad aún en la altura máxima. Soporta perfectamente celulares, cámaras de acción y lo más importante... ¡Cámaras Reflex!Es muy ligero y compacto lo cual lo convierte en el compañero ideal para viaje o eventos en los que se necesita discreción. Para fotografía de prensa ayuda mucho al tener una herramienta tan versátil y que no ocupa mucho espacio.

Me resulto muy util para tomar fotos en los eventos familiares que hemos celebrado en casa a raíz de la pandemia, y lo mejor de todo es me facilito tomar mis clases en zoom con el celular. Muy buen producto el boton con bluetooth es lo mejor.
